intro: Ptychopyxis triradiata, commonly known as the three-rayed starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other genera such as Oncidium and Limnanthes. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Ptychopyxis triradiata is often found growing in moist, rocky habitats at high elevations.
